Ethan Regan: The Only Tour Ever with Dipsea Flower

Hideout Chicago

  November 6, 2024 8:30 PM

Doors Open: 8:00 PM
Ethan Regan
 
Hailing from Charlotte, NC, Ethan Regan speaks to audiences through a strong, but natural blend of influenced sounds. Putting out his first record at the age of 13, Ethan quickly allowed music to consume and control his life for over half a decade, and has not looked back since.

Drawing sonic inspiration from his favorite acts like John Mayer, Damien Rice, and Zac Bryan - Ethan is pushing the boundaries of what it means to be a singer songwriter in today’s crowded indie-folk arena. Following the release of stand-out singles like “wildflowers” and “katherine” - Ethan is now quickly turning industry heads - bridging his influence of folk, funk, rock, jazz, and hip-hop into a genre of his very own.

At the young age of 21, there’s no denying that Ethan Regan will be one of the next greats to sweep the ears of music lovers and concert goers across the global music circuit.
 
Dipsea Flower
 
Dipsea Flower is the Folk-Rock project of Singer/Songwriter Ari Rosenberg. The group was founded in Northern California, and is currently based in Boston. Their debut single “Hummingbird” (released November 2023) quickly climbed over 400k streams in a matter of months. This led to a collaboration with esteemed record producer Jon Gilbert (Mt. Joy, Flipturn, etc.) on their second single “Sundance”, a summery folk-rock sing-along released in May 2024.

$15 ADV/ $15 DOS plus fees
